title: New Champ Illaoi

embed.description: The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers! Manage your expectations accordingly. ) ! ! http://l3cdn.riotgames.com/releases/pbe/projects/lol_air_client/releases/0.0.3.222/files/assets/sounds/pt_BR/champions/Illaoi.mp3 * *: The PBE is a testing grounds for new, tentative, and sometimes radical changes.

body:
So today Surrender @ 20 Posted a new audio recording for illaoi a new champ.

The only thing that sucks is that it in Portages.

replies.body: I hope it's a human champion finally.
me too. please... give us a human champ already...
Umm was ekko human?
*violently suppresses urge to make obvious racist joke*
{{champion:62}}
I loled
wtf u talkin about bard is easily the most human thing ive ever seen i mean he easily shows the what are those factor!!! {{champion:432}}
with how much damage he pumps out, no way he is human.
As a black person, this is the only response I like XD
{{champion:268}} was once human
_Illaoi_ is a human. For more information read _Shadow and Fortune_.

don't tell anyone that i'm bra{{champion:26}}  2
HUE HUE HUE

It hasn't even been a month since {{champion:203}} 's release and Riot is already hinting at an upcoming champ. This is the exact way how Ekko was teased, but I wouldn't be surprised if it took them a while to release this intriguing character. According to the translation provided by YumaS2Astral (NA) and also the one on Surrender@20, it would appear this champion is some sort of teacher or master who specializes in some kind of martial art, this is why she is saying that she's not a big fan of talking, but rather of combat. Another idea that comes to mind is that he's a skeleton because of the way he expresses his idea of punishment, instead of threating with death, like most other champions in League, he threatened to break a bone, which is exactly what a skeleton-like creature would say. Keep in mind, that these are just my thought and opinion on what this select quote might mean, nothing has been officially confirmed by Riot ... yet.
Riot also said that the next champion release would be sometime in 2015 as well
Nawwww the next champ is gunna be released 2017
That's Ao shin
no Ao Shin is coming in 2050.
I think you mean to say Soonâ„¢
If only he would come that soon...

> It hasn't even been a month since {{champion:203}} 's release and Riot is already hinting at an upcoming champ. This is the exact way how Ekko was teased, but I wouldn't be surprised if it took them a while to release this intriguing character. According to the translation provided by YumaS2Astral (NA) and also the one on Surrender@20, it would appear this champion is some sort of teacher or master who specializes in some kind of martial art, this is why she is saying that she's not a big fan of talking, but rather of combat. Another idea that comes to mind is that he's a skeleton because of the way he expresses his idea of punishment, instead of threating with death, like most other champions in League, he threatened to break a bone, which is exactly what a skeleton-like creature would say. Keep in mind, that these are just my thought and opinion on what this select quote might mean, nothing has been officially confirmed by Riot ... yet.

They have like 5-8 champs in the works at any one point, so there may be times when they have multiple complete at once. They often adjust their release spacing when they have other events that will take a bit of time (Tahm and the Bilgewater event).

im quite suspicious about talking about lessons and teaching, and breaking bones in her audio. Do you remember academy skins? 
http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Ahri_6.jpg  theres a woman with a big hammer in top right
Thats not a woman xD

there are two people in that window, a man(professor {{champion:13}} maybe) and a woman (Illaoi maybe).
here's a wider version of the splash-art: http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/9/93/Ahri_AcademySkin.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150812194827

Hmmm... The longer I look at it, the more the question intrigues me- Is it really a hammer and who is really holding it?
I mean, the bulky figure's pose makes it look like it's wielding a hammer, but if you look closely, the handle/hilt may seem like a spike. What do you think? I'm not very sure myself.
That shadow isn't a woman lol its way too bulky and the shoulders are man like, it is not a woman
It may be. Woman _can_ be bulky- In fact Illaoi is described in _Shadow and Fortune_ as a very giant-like woman.

I'm just saying man, that looks more like the form of {{champion:126}} or Debonair {{champion:3}} 
sure women can be bulky you're deff right but you can still tell apart from a bulky guy and a bulky chick

That was a good call, nicely done.

Since she wants people to learn lessons, maybe she's a _teacher_. 
Since she wants to break bones, maybe she's a _fighter_.
Since she doesn't like lectures, maybe she has a _silence_.

My guess is that she is an elder guru master of martial arts. Female Master Roshi.

A female pervert?

When was the last time we had one of those?

Ahri?
Lol
Academy Illaoi confirmed?
Some people say it's too soon for a new champ... I say after Kindred, the next champ couldn't come soon enough.

I happen to like Kindred...but I don't have a problem with another champion coming out so soon.

I only started playing about a year ago, but some of my veteran friends were complaining how they used to get new champions WAY more frequently (I'll exclude a specific duration to avoid horribly exaggerating). And yeah, if Kindred didn't suit you, then maybe another new champion like Illaoi could be nice for you, no?

I liked everything about Kindred but their kit, it seemed a little bland and generic except for the ult. But yeah that's the idea, hopefully the next champ will bring something a little more interesting to the rift.

I see what you mean...but I kinda like it, to be honest. It's fairly simple and a marksman built for the jungle.

On another note, excited for Illaoi?
Yes very, she seems pretty cool from that lore piece she was in, and she might be a mage xD

Oh yeah! I'm really liking Shadow and Fortune and all these drawn-out stories. Like the Bilgewater event before.

Yeah, I'm a total lore nerd. ^^;
I don't know about you guys but the new champion sounds like a mature lady to me. Not a man.

So we think it's feminine and it talks about martial discipline, or learning things the hard way, it also has a filter over its base voice over, so it's not necessarily human (it could be a ghostly humanoid like kalista or something)

I reckon it's gonna be another member of the zaun gang that VI, Jinx and Ekko were part of, the Ill part looks like the roman numerals for 3, and she sounds like she could have grown up having to fend for herself
so is it a male of female, i thinks its a male champ, but people are saying it sounded liek female.
Sounds like a deep female voice to me.
